course_title: Philanthropy Lab: Addressing Inequality in Atlanta
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 33 / Seats Avail: 6Waitlist Total: 0
course_description: Atlanta had the highest level of income disparity among U.S. cities in 2018. This experiential learning course introduces students to the role of philanthropy, both individual and corporate, play in solving public problems, particularly income inequality in Atlanta. Topics covered include the history and theory of philanthropic giving in the U.S. as well as leading strategic and equitable philanthropic management approaches. During the course, students form their own ¿mini-foundations¿ that identify and make grants totaling $50-$85K to local nonprofits.
